from deoldify import device
from deoldify.device_id import DeviceId
#choices:  CPU, GPU0...GPU7
device.set(device=DeviceId.GPU0)

import torch

if not torch.cuda.is_available():
    print('GPU not available.')

source.4f129620:
source_url = 'https://img.rawpixel.com/s3fs-private/rawpixel_images/website_content/pd43-5-85-ploy_3.jpg?w=1000&dpr=1&fit=default&crop=default&q=65&vib=3&con=3&usm=15&bg=F4F4F3&ixlib=js-2.2.1&s=3a3a0356e0a548fce11bf33414b5e9f9' 
render_factor = 35  # (recommended min: 7, max: 40)

if source_url is not None and source_url !='':
    image_path = colorizer.plot_transformed_image_from_url(url=source_url, render_factor=render_factor, compare=True, watermarked=False)
    show_image_in_notebook(image_path)
else:
    print('Provide an image url and try again.')
source.42f9c3f9:
Quick way to colorize images with [DeOldify](https://github.com/jantic/DeOldify). More specifically, this is a stripped down version of ImageColorizerColab.ipynb

In the last cell, change source_url to the image URL of your choice, and adjust the resolution of the generated layer with render_factor.
